text.section: The Secretary shall carry out and enforce the provisions of this article and the rules and regulations adopted under this article.

The Secretary may delegate duties, powers, and functions as provided in this article to a health officer for a county or to another county official authorized to administer and enforce environmental laws.

In those counties where a county official other than the health officer is authorized to administer and enforce State environmental laws under this section, the county shall establish minimum qualifications for that county official that include standards of education and experience related to environmental issues.

section.section: On or before October 1 of each year, the Secretary, in consultation with the Attorney General, shall submit to the Legislative Policy Committee, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, a report on enforcement activities conducted by the Department during the previous fiscal year.
The information required in the report under paragraph (3) of this subsection shall be organized according to each program specified.

In addition to the information required in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, for the Lead Paint Program under Title 6, Subtitle 8 of this article, the report shall include the total number or amount of:
Affected properties registered; and
Inspectors or other persons accredited by the Department, for whom accreditation has not been surrendered, suspended, or revoked.

In addition to the information required in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, for the Controlled Hazardous Substances Program under Title 7, Subtitle 2 of this article, the report shall include the following lists, updated to reflect the most recent information available for the immediately preceding fiscal year:
Possible controlled hazardous substance sites compiled in accordance with § 7-223(a) of this article;
Proposed sites listed in accordance with § 7-223(c) of this article at which the Department intends to conduct preliminary site assessments; and
Hazardous waste sites in the disposal site registry compiled in accordance with § 7-223(f) of this article.

In addition to the information required in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, for the Drinking Water Program, the report shall include the total number of:
Actions to prevent public water system contamination or to respond to a Safe Drinking Water Act emergency under §§ 9-405 and 9-406 of this article; and
Notices given to the public by public water systems under § 9-410 of this article.
